title.narrative: WASH EPRP:WASH

description.narrative: Target communities have increased capacity for effective emergency preparedness, response and recovery for Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), aligned with the Core Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action., which contributes to Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water sector policy and administrative management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Target communities have increased capacity for effective emergency preparedness, response and recovery for WASH, aligned with theCore Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action.

description.narrative: WASH humanitarian response interventions continued to support the food insecurity and malnutrition response, flooding forcing displacement, COVID-19 response, conflict displacement needs, and continued services to IDP camps. ;UNICEF continued providing leadership to the WASH Cluster as well as core pipeline supplies, coordination and information management for better preparedness and response, and supported 623,955 people with access to safe water and 77,199 with safe sanitation. This year UNICEF provided critical life-saving supplies to 799,098 people throughout the country. The WASH Cluster was one of the first to roll out the global WASH Severity Classification (WSC) exercise in 2021. ; | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:11/01/2022
